result.execSummary:
The defendant Amari C Huffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
- No fine due to inability to pay. 
- Court sets restitution at zero. 
- Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges. 
- All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 04/03/2023 to convert to a civil judgment

- AODA assessment and recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

- no possession of illegal drugs 
- no possession of firearms

- Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. 
- Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari C Huffman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amari C Huffman in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 9 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- 15 hours community service
- no possession of illegal drugs
- no possession of firearms
Court further ordered:
- no fine due to inability to pay
- AODA assessment and recommended treatment

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 04/03/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Amari C Huffman in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Amari C Huffman in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court case is in resolution posture and requests plea and sentencing. 
Court order matter adjourned back to Br. 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant previously posted $500 cash bail. Court orders that the $500 cash be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amari C Huffman in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
